001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.util.Collections;
004import java.util.HashMap;
005import java.util.HashSet;
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.Set;
008import java.util.function.Function;
009import java.util.stream.Collectors;
010import java.util.stream.Stream;
011
012/**
013 * Given a stream of objects of type {@code X}, and a mapping that extracts
014 * objects of type {@code Y}, this class creates an index of type {@code Y} and
015 * acts as a function for retrieving the set of {@code X} which map to
016 * {@code Y}. This is basically the same as a foreign key lookup.
017 *
018 * @param <Y> a key-like object
019 * @param <X> a value-like object
020 */
021public class Inversion<Y, X> implements Function<Y, Set<X>> {
022
023        /**
024         * cache the inversion of a function over a stream of data.
025         *
026         * @param <Y>  the type of the key-like objects to retrieve
027         * @param <X>  the type of the value-like objects to retrieve
028         * @param fn   the function to invert; should be a mapping from X to Y
029         * @param data the stream of X objects to process and cache
030         * @return an Inversion object that can be used to retrieve sets of X for
031         *         given Y values
032         */
033        public static <Y, X> Inversion<Y, X> cache(
034                        Function<X, Y> fn, Stream<X> data
035        ) {
036                return new Inversion<>(fn, data);
037        }
038
039        Function<X, Y> fn;
040        Map<Y, Set<X>> cache = new HashMap<>();
041        Class<Y> input = null;
042
043        Class<X> output = null;
044
045        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
046        private Inversion(Function<X, Y> fn, Stream<X> data) {
047                this.fn = fn;
048                data.forEach(x -> {
049                        var y = fn.apply(x);
050                        if (this.input == null) { this.input = (Class<Y>) y.getClass(); }
051                        if (this.output == null) { this.output = (Class<X>) x.getClass(); }
052                        this.cache.computeIfAbsent(y, v -> new HashSet<>()).add(x);
053                });
054        }
055
056        /**
057         * Apply the inversion function to retrieve the set of X that map to Y.
058         *
059         * @param t the key-like object for which to retrieve the corresponding set
060         *          of value-like objects
061         * @return a set of X objects that map to the given Y object; returns an
062         *         empty set if no mappings exist
063         */
064        @Override
065        public Set<X> apply(Y t) {
066                return this.cache.getOrDefault(t, Collections.emptySet());
067        }
068
069        /**
070         * Apply the inversion function with type checking to retrieve the set of X
071         * that map to Y.
072         *
073         * @param <Y1> the type of the key-like object for which to retrieve the
074         *             corresponding set of value-like objects; should be compatible
075         *             with Y
076         * @param <X1> the expected type of the value-like objects in the output
077         * @param t    the key-like object for which to retrieve the corresponding
078         *             set of value-like objects
079         * @param as   the class object representing the expected output type; used
080         *             for type checking
081         * @return a set of X objects that map to the given Y object; returns an
082         *         empty set if no mappings exist
083         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input type of t does not match the
084         *                                  expected input type or if the output type
085         *                                  does not match the expected output type
086         */
087        public <Y1, X1> Set<X1> apply(Y1 t, Class<X1> as) {
088                if (!this.input.isAssignableFrom(t.getClass()))
089                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
090                                        "Incorrect input type: " + t.getClass().getName()
091                                                        + " should be a " + this.input.getName()
092                        );
093                if (!as.isAssignableFrom(this.output)) throw new IllegalArgumentException(
094                                "Incorrect output type: " + as.getName() + " should be a "
095                                                + this.output.getName()
096                );
097                Y y = this.input.cast(t);
098                return this.cache.getOrDefault(y, Collections.emptySet()).stream()
099                                .map(x -> as.cast(x)).collect(Collectors.toSet());
100        }
101
102        /**
103         * Apply the inversion function without type checking to retrieve the set of
104         * X that map to Y.
105         *
106         * @param <Y1> the type of the key-like object for which to retrieve the
107         *             corresponding set of value-like objects; should be compatible
108         *             with Y
109         * @param t    the key-like object for which to retrieve the corresponding
110         *             set of value-like objects
111         * @return a set of X objects that map to the given Y object; returns an
112         *         empty set if no mappings exist
113         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input type of t does not match the
114         *                                  expected input type
115         */
116        public <Y1> Set<X> applyUnsafe(Y1 t) {
117                if (!this.input.isAssignableFrom(t.getClass()))
118                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
119                                        "Incorrect input type: " + t.getClass().getName()
120                                                        + " should be a " + this.input.getName()
121                        );
122                Y y = this.input.cast(t);
123                return this.cache.getOrDefault(y, Collections.emptySet());
124        }
125
126        /**
127         * Get the input type of the inversion function.
128         *
129         * @return the Class object representing the input type Y
130         */
131        public Class<X> outputType() {
132                return this.output;
133        }
134}
